result.execSummary:
The defendant Passion Marie Galvin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Passion Marie Galvin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Passion Marie Galvin was found guilty of Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).
  • Passion Marie Galvin was found guilty of Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.375(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation
- 68 days credit against ultimate sentence
- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs.  Payable through probation on Count 3 in St. Croix County Case 22CF435
- $250 DNA Surcharge.    Payable through probation on Count 3 in St. Croix County Case 22CF435
- AODA/Rule 25 and follow through with recommendations

- DNA Sample
- Complete psychological evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute Sobriety
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol. 
- No contact with victims with the exception of employment purposes
- Complete Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT) or an equivalent cognitive skills program. 
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees

10:08 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody. Includes 21CM230, 22CF415-INIT, 22CF435, 22CM366, 22CM468. Atty Harrelson recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to 22CF435 Count 3: Throw/ Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor- 941.375(2) and Count 4: Throw/ Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor- 941.375(2). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 22CF432 Counts 1 & 2, 21CM230, 22CM366, and 22CM468. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:

22CF435 Count 3: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 180 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $268.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- 68 days credit against ultimate sentence

22CF435 Count 4: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 180 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $268.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- 68 days credit against ultimate sentence

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 

- DNA Sample
- Rule 25 and follow through with recommendations
- Complete psychological evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Prescribed medications only as prescribed
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- No Contact with victims with the exception of employment purposes
- Obtain GED/HSED
- Complete Moral Reconation Therapy (MRT) or an equivalent cognitive skills program
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation 

22CF415: WOE: Defendant wishes to voluntarily waive extradition. Defendant executes Waiver and court certifies same. S/T from defendant.

10:32 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Passion Marie Galvin. Defendant Passion Marie Galvin in court, in custody. INCLUDES STC (for Branch 2): 21CM230, 22CF415, 22CF435 and 22CM366, FPT: 22CF401. Atty. Harrelson states there is an agreement to Branch 2 cases and will be requesting plea/sentencing hearing on 21CM230, 22CM366, 22CF415 and 22CF435, DE will then waive extradition to MN to deal with pending cases and pre-sign waiver of extradition back to WI, requests to remove JT and reschedule as STC, DE will be entering Adult and Teen Challenge, requests bond modification. ADA Ellenwood responds, believes there will be a resolution. Court modifies bond in 22CF415 and removes JT from calendar. Court sets STC on 22CF401, in person appearance required. Adjourned: 10:43 AM. kma
